summary: This document is a prison administrative record for Jeffrey Epstein, dated July 29, 2019. It notes he is pending a disciplinary hearing for a code violation related to self-mutilation and references a prior suicide attempt on January 23, 2019. A separate case note from July 23, 2019, describes him being found with a homemade rope around his neck.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the prison administrative record, listed as pending a disciplinary hearing for self-mutilation and referenced in a suicide attempt incident.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Identified as Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate in the incident report from July 23, 2019.

connections.description: Tartaglione is identified as Epstein's cellmate in the July 23, 2019, incident report.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted suicide while in custody.

events.title: Epstein Found with Homemade Rope
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found with a homemade rope around his neck, prompting a threat assessment case.

events.title: Pending Disciplinary Hearing
events.description: Administrative record notes Epstein is pending a Disciplinary Hearing Officer (DHO) hearing for a code 228 violation related to self-mutilation.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was involved in a suicide attempt on January 23, 2019, while in custody.
On July 23, 2019, Epstein was found with a homemade rope around his neck; his cellmate was Nicholas Tartaglione.
As of July 29, 2019, Epstein was pending a disciplinary hearing for a code violation (228) related to self-mutilation.
